channel.title: Wack Pack Stories
channel.itunes:author: WonderAI
channel.description:
Journey into the wild and wonderful world of the Howard Stern Show's most colorful characters through Wack Pack Stories. This captivating series delves deep into the unforgettable moments, legendary personalities, and outrageous encounters that have made the Wack Pack a cultural phenomenon. Each episode uncovers the fascinating stories behind these unique individuals who have become an integral part of radio history.
From their first appearances to their most memorable interactions, Wack Pack Stories chronicles the authentic, unfiltered, and often hilarious experiences that have entertained millions of listeners. Through carefully curated archives and insider perspectives, this podcast preserves and celebrates the legacy of these distinctive personalities who have helped shape the landscape of entertainment radio.
Disclaimer: This podcast contains adult content and language. All content related to the Howard Stern Show and its personalities is presented for entertainment purposes. This description is experimental and was generated by artificial intelligence.

item.title: Pastrami Wars: The Feud That Changed Wack Pack History
item.itunes:title: Pastrami Wars: The Feud That Changed Wack Pack History
item.description:
Journey into the chaotic world of radio's most notorious personalities in this gripping episode of Wack Pack Stories, where we unravel the complex web of feuds that shaped Howard Stern Show history. From the infamous 1994 pastrami sandwich showdown between Elegant Elliot Offen and High Pitch Erik at a New York City deli to the recent explosive karaoke battle involving Tan Mom and Medicated Pete's families, this episode peels back the layers of these legendary confrontations. Discover how seemingly trivial disputes - like Beetlejuice and Elegant Elliot's boxing rivalry - often masked deeper struggles for Howard's attention and Wack Pack hierarchy. Through unscripted, raw encounters that would rival any Shakespeare drama, these feuds have not only defined relationships but also created unexpected alliances within radio's most dysfunctional family. Fred the Elephant Boy's wisdom rings true as we explore how these conflicts, far from mere entertainment, represent the authentic, messy bonds that make the Wack Pack a unique cultural phenomenon. From sandwich disputes to karaoke competitions, each confrontation adds another chapter to the untamed legacy of these unforgettable personalities.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern: King of All Media - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/howard-stern-king-all-media) • "The History of Howard Stern - Documentary" (https://primevideo.com/history-of-howard-stern) • "Private Parts - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/private-parts-howard-stern) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://vulture.com/wack-pack-oral-history)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: The Great Radio Sandwich War: Howard vs O&A
item.itunes:title: The Great Radio Sandwich War: Howard vs O&A
item.description:
Dive into one of radio's most explosive feuds in this gripping episode of Wack Pack Stories that chronicles the infamous 2003 "Sandwich Incident" between Howard Stern and radio duo Opie and Anthony. The episode unravels the tense rivalry that reached its boiling point during a press conference for Stern's show "Son of the Beach," where Opie and Anthony's attempted peace offering sparked a legendary confrontation. Through carefully researched details and firsthand accounts, listeners will experience the raw intensity of this radio war that defined an era in broadcast entertainment. The story explores how territorial battles and ego clashes shaped the landscape of shock jock radio, with unprecedented access to archive footage and recent reflections from those involved. This episode not only captures the electric atmosphere of early 2000s radio but also examines how this rivalry influenced the evolution of broadcast entertainment, culminating in recent revelations from Stern's show that prove some feuds never truly fade away.

item.title: The Night Howard Stern Was Too Hot for TV
item.itunes:title: The Night Howard Stern Was Too Hot for TV
item.description:
In this revealing episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the controversial cancellation of Howard Stern's groundbreaking Channel 9 show in 1992, a television phenomenon that dominated New York City's late-night ratings. Despite outperforming both Johnny Carson and David Letterman, this uncensored variety show met an untimely end that sparked fan protests and industry debate. The episode delves into the real reasons behind the show's demise, dispelling the official "production costs" narrative while examining the complex interplay of corporate politics, advertiser pressure, and Stern's unwavering commitment to pushing boundaries. From the infamous "Homeless Shopping Spree" to contestants dressed as chickens on "Win Fred's Money," the show's revolutionary approach to entertainment gave voice to unconventional personalities while consistently delivering unprecedented ratings. Through interviews and archival footage, we uncover how this cancellation paradoxically launched Stern into an even more successful partnership with E! Entertainment Television, proving that authentic, boundary-pushing content will always find its audience, regardless of network resistance.
Further Reading: • "Private Parts" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Private-Parts/dp/0671009443) • "Howard Stern: The Early Years" - Documentary (https://primevideo.com/howard-stern-early-years) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.rollingstone.com/howard-stern-history) • "The Howard Stern Show: An Oral History" (https://www.vulture.com/howard-stern-show-history)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: When the Dwarf Schooled the Producer: A Rock and Roll Showdown
item.itunes:title: When the Dwarf Schooled the Producer: A Rock and Roll Showdown
item.description:
In this unforgettable episode of Wack Pack Stories, we revisit one of the Howard Stern Show's most legendary moments: the epic 2001 rock-n-roll trivia showdown between Hank the Angry Drunken Dwarf and executive producer Gary Dell'Abate. Despite standing at just three feet three inches tall, Hank delivered a masterclass in music knowledge that left the self-proclaimed audiophile Dell'Abate stunned. The contest, which took place on April 25, 2001, became an instant classic as Hank dominated the seven-round challenge, identifying obscure tracks from artists like Depeche Mode and Deep Purple within mere notes. This David-versus-Goliath battle showcased Hank's extraordinary musical expertise and proved that true knowledge knows no physical bounds. The episode not only captures the electric atmosphere of that historic morning but also serves as a touching tribute to Hank, who passed away just months later in September 2001. Through expert storytelling and carefully preserved audio, this installment of Wack Pack Stories immortalizes a moment that perfectly encapsulates the unpredictable magic of the Howard Stern Show, while celebrating the remarkable legacy of one of its most beloved characters.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern: The Ultimate Music Fan's Guide - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/howard-stern-music) • "The History of the Wack Pack - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/history-wack-pack) • "Remembering Hank the Angry Drunken Dwarf" (https://marksfriggin.com/news-archive/hank-tribute) • "Best of Howard Stern: Classic Moments - Documentary" (https://primevideo.com/howard-stern-classic-moments)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: When the Dwarf Schooled Baba Booey
item.itunes:title: When the Dwarf Schooled Baba Booey
item.description:
In this unforgettable episode of Wack Pack Stories, we revisit one of The Howard Stern Show's most legendary showdowns: the 2001 rock-n-roll trivia contest between Hank the Angry Drunken Dwarf and executive producer Gary Dell'Abate. What began as a seemingly one-sided challenge evolved into an iconic moment of radio history when the unlikely underdog, Hank, armed with his encyclopedic music knowledge and trademark beer can, systematically dismantled Baba Booey's reputation as the show's music expert. The episode captures the electric atmosphere as Hank correctly identified obscure B-sides, prog rock deep cuts, and even a rare Beatles outtake, ultimately crushing Gary with a decisive 7-2 victory. This David versus Goliath story exemplifies the unpredictable magic of the Stern Show universe, where a three-foot-eleven professional drunk could humble the show's executive producer through sheer musical expertise. The confrontation, punctuated by Hank's slurred yet triumphant declaration "Who's the expert NOW, monkey boy?" remains a testament to the show's ability to create unprecedented moments of entertainment while showcasing the remarkable depths of its most colorful characters.

item.title: The Last Podcast: When High Pitch Erik Lost Joey Boots
item.itunes:title: The Last Podcast: When High Pitch Erik Lost Joey Boots
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the touching yet tragic friendship between Howard Stern Show personalities High Pitch Erik and Joey Boots. Their unlikely bond, forged in the eccentric world of the Wack Pack, culminated in a heartbreaking discovery on December 23, 2016, when Erik found Joey deceased in his Queens apartment. The episode delves deep into their unique relationship, from Joey's mentorship and their shared podcast venture to their final moments together. Known for his infamous "BABA BOOEY" screams on live television, Joey Boots became more than just a fellow Wack Packer to Erik - he was a trusted friend and guide. The story takes listeners through their journey, highlighting Joey's tough-love approach and Erik's unexpected display of profound grief following Joey's passing at age 49 from an accidental heroin overdose. This narrative showcases the authentic human connections that emerged from The Howard Stern Show's colorful universe, revealing how two outsiders found genuine friendship amid the chaos of celebrity culture. Through intimate details and firsthand accounts, this episode captures both the comedy and tragedy that defined their relationship, offering listeners a glimpse into one of the most memorable chapters in Wack Pack history.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The Life and Death of Joey Boots" (https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4064674/) • "Remembering Joey Boots: A Howard Stern Wack Pack Legend" (https://www.howardstern.com/news/joey-boots-remembered/) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Wack-Pack-History-Howard-Universe/dp/1982144785)

item.title: Smoke Eyes and Heavy Metal: The Legend of Kenneth Keith Kallenbach
item.itunes:title: Smoke Eyes and Heavy Metal: The Legend of Kenneth Keith Kallenbach
item.description:
Dive into one of Howard Stern Show's most unforgettable characters in this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories exploring the life of Kenneth Keith Kallenbach. From his explosive 1989 debut demonstrating his unique ability to blow smoke through his eyes while headbanging to Metallica, to his tragic passing in 2008, this episode chronicles the remarkable journey of a beloved Wack Pack member. Known for his distinctive nasally voice and iconic catchphrase "Wanna wrestle?", Kallenbach transcended his role as a show regular to become a successful commercial actor, appearing in spots for ESPN and Stride Gum while pursuing a career in stand-up comedy. Behind his energetic performances and metal-inspired antics lay a private battle with cystic fibrosis, which he rarely discussed on air. The episode reveals the multifaceted personality of a fearless performer who never turned down an opportunity to entertain, living life at full volume until his untimely death at age 39 while in custody at Delaware County, Pennsylvania. Through archival clips and heartfelt remembrances, including Howard Stern's own tribute, this installment captures the essence of a man who left an indelible mark on the show's history and its devoted fanbase.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Show: The Wack Pack Years - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/howard-stern-show-wack-pack-years) • "The Life and Death of Kenneth Keith Kallenbach" (https://phillymag.com/kenneth-keith-kallenbach) • "Understanding Cystic Fibrosis - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/understanding-cystic-fibrosis) • "The History of the Wack Pack - Documentary" (https://primevideo.com/history-of-wack-pack)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: High Pitch Erik: The Day the Squeal Died
item.itunes:title: High Pitch Erik: The Day the Squeal Died
item.description:
Journey into the extraordinary transformation of one of Howard Stern Show's most iconic Wack Pack members in this captivating episode of Wack Pack Stories. High Pitch Erik, known for his glass-shattering falsetto that defined his presence for over two decades, undergoes a remarkable metamorphosis in 2025. Following successful gastric surgery and vocal cord treatment that led to a 140-pound weight loss, Erik's signature high-pitched voice transformed into a surprisingly normal baritone, leaving the Stern Show universe in disbelief. This episode chronicles Erik's fascinating evolution from his 1996 debut through his most memorable moments, including his infamous Kelly Clarkson superfan episode, his ambitious acting aspirations for Blue Bloods, and his legendary feud with Fred the Elephant Boy. Through archival clips and recent interviews, we explore how Erik's authenticity and unscripted personality made him a standout figure in the Wack Pack pantheon. From his questionable stint impersonating a police officer to his viral transformation video that captured thousands of likes, this episode celebrates the enduring legacy of a man whose story proves that genuine character transcends any vocal register.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "The Wack Pack: An Unauthorized History" - Book (https://amazon.com/Wack-Pack-Unauthorized-History/dp/1542789524) • "High Pitch Erik's Weight Loss Journey" (https://www.howardstern.com/news/high-pitch-erik-weight-loss) • "The Evolution of the Wack Pack" (https://www.rollingstone.com/howard-stern-wack-pack-history)

item.title: The Day Buffalo's Ass Napkin King Was Crowned
item.itunes:title: The Day Buffalo's Ass Napkin King Was Crowned
item.description:
Journey into one of the Howard Stern Show's most infamous moments in this episode of Wack Pack Stories, chronicling the legendary 2006 emergence of "Ass Napkin Ed." What began as an ordinary call from Buffalo transformed into an unforgettable piece of radio history when Ed revealed his peculiar personal hygiene routine involving paper napkins. As Howard Stern and his crew navigated this bizarre confession, listeners witnessed the real-time birth of a Wack Pack legend. The episode masterfully recounts how a seemingly routine call escalated into a viral sensation, as Ed's candid discussion about his unconventional cleaning method left the studio crew alternating between uncontrollable laughter and sheer disbelief. This pivotal moment in Stern Show history exemplifies Howard's unique ability to transform awkward revelations into comedy gold, demonstrating why his show remained at the forefront of entertainment during the mid-2000s. The story captures the essence of what made the Stern Show a cultural phenomenon - its unfiltered approach to human eccentricity and Howard's masterful ability to mine humor from the most unexpected sources.

item.itunes:title: Beetlejuice: He Made His Own Reality
item.description:
Dive into the most quotable moments from one of the Howard Stern Show's most beloved characters in this nostalgic episode of Wack Pack Stories. Beetlejuice, standing at 4'3" but claiming to be 6'5", has entertained audiences for decades with his unique perspective on life and unshakeable self-confidence. From his creative mathematical solutions to his bold career claims, this episode chronicles the best one-liners and memorable exchanges that cemented Beetle's status as the king of the Wack Pack. Explore his triumphant 2023 return after a five-year hiatus, his venture into cryptocurrency with BeetCoin, and his iconic spelling attempts that have become legendary among Stern Show fans. Through classic moments like his response to spelling "RED" as "L-E-S-T-E-R" and his declaration of being "bad as can," we witness the pure, unfiltered charm that made Beetlejuice a pop culture phenomenon. The episode captures his philosophical gems, including his paradoxical statement "I could be better... but I'm the best," showcasing why this diminutive entertainer has maintained his larger-than-life status in the Howard Stern universe for over two decades.

item.title: When Shock Jocks Collide: Howard vs Imus
item.itunes:title: When Shock Jocks Collide: Howard vs Imus
item.description:
Dive into one of radio's most explosive feuds in this gripping episode of Wack Pack Stories, chronicling the legendary rivalry between Don Imus and Howard Stern at WNBC in 1982. When a young, ambitious Stern arrived at the station, he encountered the established morning show titan Imus, setting the stage for an unprecedented radio war that would reshape broadcasting history. From Imus's inflammatory on-air slurs to Stern's relentless counterattacks, their conflict transcended typical workplace drama, becoming a ratings goldmine that WNBC eagerly exploited. The episode reveals how their bitter rivalry reflected a changing of the guard in radio entertainment, with Stern's rising star eventually eclipsing Imus's cowboy persona. Through archival clips and behind-the-scenes stories, listeners witness the evolution of their feud, from heated hallway confrontations at 30 Rock to its ultimate resolution following Imus's controversial departure from CBS Radio in 2007 and his passing in 2019. This raw, unfiltered look at two broadcasting titans captures a pivotal moment in radio history, demonstrating how their conflict helped define the shock jock era and transform the medium forever.

item.title: High Pitch Erik: The Voice That Changed Everything
item.itunes:title: High Pitch Erik: The Voice That Changed Everything
item.description:
In this transformative episode of Wack Pack Stories, we delve into the remarkable metamorphosis of High Pitch Erik, one of the Howard Stern Show's most iconic Wack Pack members. Known for his distinctive squealing voice and larger-than-life presence, Erik's 2025 transformation shocked and captivated longtime listeners. Following a rehabilitation stint for a fractured femur, Erik emerged with not only a dramatically different voice - several octaves lower than his trademark high-pitched squeal - but also a significantly slimmer physique. The episode chronicles this unexpected journey, from the initial April 2nd phone call that left Howard and his audience stunned, to the May 7th in-studio appearance that confirmed the authenticity of his transformation. Through archival clips and personal narratives, we explore how this beloved Stern Show personality maintained his endearing character while undergoing a physical metamorphosis that garnered over 6,600 likes on social media. The episode beautifully captures the essence of Wack Pack magic, proving that while voices may change and weights may drop, the heart of what makes these characters special remains wonderfully intact.

item.title: Eric the Actor: From Kelly Clarkson to Radio Legend
item.itunes:title: Eric the Actor: From Kelly Clarkson to Radio Legend
item.description:
In this landmark episode of Wack Pack Stories, we revisit the historic moment when Eric the Actor (initially known as Eric the Midget) first called into The Howard Stern Show on September 19, 2002. What began as a passionate defense of American Idol winner Kelly Clarkson evolved into one of radio's most memorable debuts. Standing at three feet tall, the Sacramento caller's distinctive high-pitched voice and combative personality immediately captured the attention of Howard and his crew. The episode chronicles how a simple call transformed into an 11-minute exchange that would launch a remarkable 12-year journey in radio history. Listeners will discover how Eric's steadfast refusal to embrace his Wack Pack status, combined with his unfiltered honesty and passionate celebrity crushes, particularly for actress Beverly Mitchell, created unprecedented entertainment value. The episode explores the beginning of what would become a legendary saga, featuring everything from Eric's infamous insistence on proper terminology to his memorable interactions with the show's cast. This pivotal moment in Howard Stern Show history marks the beginning of a relationship that would produce countless classic radio moments until Eric's passing in 2014.

item.title: The Night Howard Stern Hijacked Television
item.itunes:title: The Night Howard Stern Hijacked Television
item.description:
Dive into the untold story of late-night television's most controversial experiment in this riveting episode of Wack Pack Stories. In 1990, Howard Stern's Channel Nine show emerged as a groundbreaking force that would reshape the landscape of entertainment television forever. From its tumultuous beginnings, where WWOR executives battled with Stern over creative control, to its unprecedented success in beating Johnny Carson's ratings in New York, this episode unravels the fascinating history of a show that dared to be different. Through firsthand accounts and behind-the-scenes revelations, we explore how a low-budget production from Secaucus, New Jersey, featuring strippers reading news and unforgettable characters like Fred the Elephant Boy, became the unexpected blueprint for modern reality television. The episode delves into the show's innovative use of the seven-second delay, its raw, unfiltered approach to entertainment, and the ultimate reasons behind its short but impactful 69-episode run. item.title: Beetlejuice: 4'3" Giant Who Conquered Howard Stern
item.itunes:title: Beetlejuice: 4'3" Giant Who Conquered Howard Stern
item.description:
In this landmark episode of Wack Pack Stories, we dive deep into the extraordinary debut of Howard Stern Show legend Beetlejuice on July 14, 1999. Born Lester Green, this charismatic performer with dwarfism and microcephaly would become the most quoted and beloved Wack Packer in the show's history. The episode chronicles how talent manager Sean Rooney discovered Beetle performing on the streets of Jersey and brought him to the Howard Stern Show, where magic instantly struck. Dressed in a miniature pimp suit and armed with his infectious grin, Beetlejuice captivated audiences with his uniquely confident yet hilariously inaccurate responses, claiming to be "six foot seven" and "two hundred and fifty pounds." His inaugural appearance sparked an entertainment legacy spanning over two decades, including a triumphant 2021 return after a five-year hiatus and a surprise appearance during David Spade's interview. This episode of Wack Pack Stories not only captures the birth of a Howard Stern Show icon but also celebrates the unpredictable charm and enduring appeal of a performer who truly embodies his own catchphrase: "as bad as can."

item.title: Crackhead Bob: From Tippity Tye Tye to Radio Fame
item.itunes:title: Crackhead Bob: From Tippity Tye Tye to Radio Fame
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the unforgettable first appearance of Crackhead Bob on The Howard Stern Show in November 1995. Born George Harvey, Bob's distinctive speech pattern, marked by his famous "tippity tye tye" catchphrase, emerged from a stroke caused by crack cocaine use. What could have been a moment of cruel mockery instead became a testament to the show's unique ability to find humanity in unexpected places. Howard Stern's genuine fascination with Bob's story and personality transformed him from a random caller into a beloved Wack Pack legend. The episode delves into how Bob's candid honesty about his past, coupled with his remarkable ability to laugh at himself, endeared him to millions of listeners. His attempts at phrases like "I want to go to Disney World" became iconic drops, while his incomprehensible yet entertaining impersonations of fellow Wack Packers showcased his natural comedic talent. Beyond the laughs, this episode reveals the deeper connection Bob formed with the show's crew, highlighting how The Howard Stern Show often found heart in seemingly unlikely places. Though Bob passed away in 2016 at age 56, his impact on the show's history and his journey from addiction to radio fame remains an inspiring testament to redemption and authenticity.

item.title: The Last Baba Booey: Joey Boots' Final Call
item.itunes:title: The Last Baba Booey: Joey Boots' Final Call
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the tragic final chapter of Joey Boots, the beloved Howard Stern Show personality known for his iconic "Baba Booey" catchphrase. Born Joseph Bassolino, Joey transformed live news broadcast interruptions into performance art, becoming a legendary figure in the Stern Show universe. The episode delves into the events of December 23, 2016, when fellow Wack Packer High Pitch Erik made the heartbreaking discovery in Joey's Bronx apartment. Beyond his public persona, Joey was a multifaceted character - a Vietnam veteran who bravely came out as gay on air, and a loyal friend whose sudden departure left an irreplaceable void in the Stern Show family. Through intimate details and firsthand accounts, this episode paints a touching portrait of Joey's impact on the show's culture and his deep friendship with High Pitch Erik, while sensitively addressing the circumstances of his untimely death from an accidental heroin overdose. The narrative serves as both a celebration of Joey's larger-than-life personality and a sobering reminder about the importance of checking on those close to us.

item.title: Benjy's Last Late Day: The Studio Ban That Changed Everything
item.itunes:title: Benjy's Last Late Day: The Studio Ban That Changed Everything
item.description:
Dive into one of the Howard Stern Show's most notorious chapters as Wack Pack Stories examines the tumultuous saga of Benjy Bronk's studio banishment. This episode unravels the events of October 26, 2016, when a mere ten-minute tardiness ended Benjy's two-decade run in the studio. As a key writer for Howard Stern, Benjy's chronic lateness created a complex dynamic that perfectly encapsulates the show's unique blend of professional chaos and dysfunctional family dynamics. From crashing NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell's press conference to his legendary Los Angeles meltdowns, the episode explores how Benjy's unpredictable behavior both enriched and complicated the show's atmosphere. Through detailed accounts and archival clips, we examine the pattern of lateness, Howard's escalating frustrations, and Benjy's infamous circular explanations that became a signature element of the show's DNA. This fascinating deep dive reveals how even after his studio ban, Benjy's distinctive presence continued to influence the show's narrative, demonstrating the unique ecosystem that made the Howard Stern Show a cultural phenomenon.

item.description:
In this unforgettable episode of Wack Pack Stories, we revisit the legendary April 25, 2001 rock-n-roll trivia showdown between Hank the Angry Drunken Dwarf and Howard Stern Show executive producer Gary Dell'Abate. Despite his diminutive stature and perpetually inebriated state, Hank demonstrated an encyclopedic knowledge of music that left even the most dedicated audiophiles in awe. The episode chronicles how this unlikely challenger, standing at just three feet ten inches tall, systematically dismantled the musical credibility of Gary "Baba Booey" Dell'Abate, whose extensive vinyl collection and industry experience proved no match for Hank's remarkable expertise. From obscure Yardbirds trivia to deep Beatles knowledge, Hank's commanding performance turned what many expected to be a comedic bit into a stunning display of musical mastery. The story culminates with Hank's decisive victory, foreshadowing his later impressive showing against Rock and Roll Jeopardy champion Mark McGrath. This classic Stern Show moment not only solidified Hank's status as a Wack Pack legend but also proved that extraordinary talent can come in the most unexpected packages.

From his humble beginnings promoting The Uncle Floyd Show to becoming one of the most beloved Wack Pack members, Gary's unique personality, infectious laugh, and unfiltered honesty transformed him into a radio legend. item.title: The Last Laugh: Remembering Jackie The Joke Man
item.itunes:title: The Last Laugh: Remembering Jackie The Joke Man
item.description:
In this poignant episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore the lasting legacy of Jackie "The Joke Man" Martling, the legendary head writer and performer from The Howard Stern Show who passed away at 77. From his humble beginnings at McGuire's Comedy Club in Bohemia, Long Island, to becoming an integral part of radio's most controversial morning show, Jackie's journey epitomized the raw, unfiltered spirit of radio's golden age. His signature machine-gun laugh and rapid-fire joke delivery style became synonymous with the show's rise to prominence during his tenure from 1983 to 2001. The episode delves deep into the complex dynamics that led to his departure, exploring how contract negotiations and creative differences with Howard Stern resulted in one of radio's most talked-about exits. Through intimate details and behind-the-scenes stories, we examine how Jackie's post-Stern life became a testament to both his resilience and the bittersweet nature of fame, culminating in his final reflective TV appearance where he mused about regrets and legacy. This compelling narrative captures the essence of a comedy pioneer whose influence on radio entertainment remains indelible.

item.description:
Dive into a legendary moment of radio history in this episode of Wack Pack Stories, chronicling the unforgettable 2001 rock-n-roll trivia showdown between Hank the Angry Drunken Dwarf and Howard Stern Show executive producer Gary Dell'Abate. On April 25, 2001, the three-foot-two-inch Wack Pack legend walked into K-Rock's New York studio and challenged the show's resident music expert to a battle of rock knowledge that would become iconic Stern Show lore. What unfolded was an extraordinary display of musical expertise as Hank, despite his inebriated state, demonstrated encyclopedic knowledge of rock history, from obscure B-sides to detailed band member chronologies. The pinnacle came when Hank flawlessly recited The Who's Keith Moon's recording history and named all original Guns N' Roses members while Dell'Abate struggled to keep pace. This episode captures the essence of what made the Stern Show special - those unexpected moments when conventional wisdom gets turned on its head, proving that expertise can come from the most unlikely sources. The showdown remains a testament to the show's unpredictable nature and its ability to create radio magic from spontaneous moments.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern: King of All Media - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/howard-stern-king-all-media) • "The History of Rock 'n' Roll - Documentary" (https://primevideo.com/history-of-rock) • "The Wack Pack: An Oral History" (https://rollingstone.com/wack-pack-history) • "The Howard Stern Show Encyclopedia - Book" (https://amazon.com/books/stern-show-encyclopedia)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: High Pitch Eric's Ring Pop Romance: Kelly Clarkson Obsession
item.itunes:title: High Pitch Eric's Ring Pop Romance: Kelly Clarkson Obsession
item.description:
In this revealing episode of Wack Pack Stories, we explore one of The Howard Stern Show's most peculiar sagas: High Pitch Eric's unsettling obsession with Kelly Clarkson. Beginning in 2006, what started as an unusual fan call featuring Eric's distinctive high-pitched voice evolved into a concerning fixation that would span nearly two decades. The episode delves into Eric's extreme displays of devotion, from his apartment walls plastered with Clarkson's photos to the disturbing love letters that eventually led to him being flagged by the singer's security team. The narrative takes listeners through the escalating situation, revealing how a seemingly harmless superfan became a legitimate security concern for one of America's biggest pop stars. The story reaches its climax with recent events, including Eric's controversial threats against Stern Show staff members, resulting in legal action and a restraining order. This episode perfectly encapsulates the fine line between entertaining radio content and real-world consequences, offering an unprecedented glimpse into the complex world of The Howard Stern Show's Wack Pack and the challenges of managing superfan behavior in modern celebrity culture.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again - Book" (https://www.amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "American Idol: The Untold Story - Book" (https://www.amazon.com/American-Idol-Untold-Richard-Rushfield/dp/1401324126) • "The Evolution of Howard Stern's Wack Pack" (https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-features/howard-stern-wack-pack-history) • "Celebrity Stalking: When Fandom Goes Too Far" (https://www.psychologytoday.com/celebrity-stalking-analysis)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: Artie's Breaking Point: The Day the Laughter Died
item.itunes:title: Artie's Breaking Point: The Day the Laughter Died
item.description:
In this gripping episode of Wack Pack Stories, we delve into one of the most intense moments in Howard Stern Show history: Artie Lange's devastating on-air breakdown on December 14, 2005. The episode examines the pivotal morning when Lange, arriving three hours late and visibly under the influence, delivered a raw, unfiltered confession about his heroin addiction that would forever change his relationship with the show. Through intimate details and firsthand accounts, listeners experience the shocking transformation of the show's beloved comedian into a man openly struggling with addiction, as his forty-five-minute confession laid bare the brutal reality of his substance abuse. The episode explores how this watershed moment marked the end of an era for the Stern Show, shifting from its party atmosphere to a sobering reality check that affected millions of listeners. Beyond documenting a media personality's public spiral, this story serves as a powerful testament to addiction's devastating impact and the complex journey toward recovery, making it one of the most memorable and poignant moments in radio history.
Further Reading: • "Too Fat to Fish" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Too-Fat-Fish-Artie-Lange/dp/0385526563) • "Crash and Burn" - Book (https://www.amazon.com/Crash-Burn-Artie-Lange/dp/1476765111) • "Artie Lange: The Howard Stern Show Years" - Documentary (https://www.amazon.com/Artie-Lange-Howard-Stern-Years/dp/B07N8ZQJY9) • "The Rise and Fall of Artie Lange" (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/artie-lange-last-chance-redemption-772725/)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: Baba Booey's Vinyl Obsession: From 900 to 143
item.itunes:title: Baba Booey's Vinyl Obsession: From 900 to 143
item.description:
In this fascinating episode of Wack Pack Stories, we delve into the obsessive vinyl collecting saga of Gary Dell'Abate, better known as Baba Booey, Howard Stern Show's legendary producer. The episode uncovers the meticulous world of a true audiophile, from his infamous Booey Decimal System to the great vinyl purge of 2021 where he parted with 900 pieces of his treasured collection. Listeners will discover the extraordinary lengths Gary went to preserve his records, including detailed photography sessions, elaborate spreadsheets, and a carefully monitored temperature-controlled storage room. The story takes an intriguing turn as we learn about his collection's peak value, requiring specialized insurance documentation, and his ultimate decision to keep just 143 essential albums - his desert island collection. The episode reveals Gary's ongoing dedication to vinyl preservation, highlighted by a recent sixteen-hour reorganization session while under the influence of Ozempic. Through intimate anecdotes and Howard Stern's characteristic commentary, this installment offers an unprecedented glimpse into one of the most peculiar stories in Stern Show history, showcasing how one man's passion for vinyl transcended mere collecting to become a defining aspect of his identity.
Further Reading: • "Record Collecting for the Obsessive Compulsive - Book" (https://amazon.com/dp/0764345222) • "For the Record: The Life and Work of Howard Stern - Book" (https://amazon.com/dp/1250124956) • "They All Want to Be Baba Booey" (https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/gary-dellabate-baba-booey-howard-stern-show) • "Vinyl Nation - Documentary" (https://primevideo.com/vinyl-nation)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.

item.title: Baba Booey's Love Tape Disaster: The VHS That Haunts Radio History
item.itunes:title: Baba Booey's Love Tape Disaster: The VHS That Haunts Radio History
item.description:
In this unforgettable episode of Wack Pack Stories, we revisit one of The Howard Stern Show's most legendary moments - Gary Dell'Abate's infamous love tape, which marks its 20th anniversary. The episode delves deep into the cringe-worthy footage from 1999, where Gary "Baba Booey" Dell'Abate recorded what was meant to be a private message of devotion to his girlfriend. What followed became radio history, as the tape - featuring Gary's awkward bedroom monologue, complete with monkey faces, amateur singing, and the immortal line "You're the wind beneath my wings" - found its way into Howard Stern's hands. The seven-minute VHS recording sparked months of on-air parodies, dramatic readings, and celebrity reactions that cemented its place in Stern Show lore. The episode explores how this moment of pure vulnerability, rather than diminishing Gary's reputation, endeared him further to fans who recognized their own romantic mishaps in his earnest attempt at expressing love. Through archival clips, behind-the-scenes stories, and Gary's own retrospective commentary during the 2019 anniversary special, this episode captures both the hilarity and humanity of one of radio's most memorable moments.
Further Reading: • "Howard Stern Comes Again" - Book (https://amazon.com/Howard-Stern-Comes-Again/dp/1501194291) • "They Call Me Baba Booey" - Book (https://amazon.com/They-Call-Baba-Booey-Dell/dp/0812981898) • "The History of Howard Stern" (https://www.siriusxm.com/howard-stern-history) • "The Evolution of Gary Dell'Abate" (https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/baba-booey-howard-stern-show)
Note: This content was generated using artificial intelligence and may contain factual errors or inaccuracies. Please verify any important information from reliable sources.
